text:
Appropriation Act (No. 2) 2023

An Act for the appropriation of $47 225 000 out of the Public Account for the services of the Government in respect of Parliament and Statutory Offices for the financial year ending on 30 June 2024
[Royal Assent 7 July 2023]

Be it enacted by Her Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Appropriation Act (No. 2) 2023 .

2. Commencement
    This Act commences on 1 July 2023, but if it does not receive the Royal Assent by that date this Act is taken to have commenced on 1 July 2023.

3. Interpretation
    For the purposes of this Act –
        Capital Services means –
                (a) public works or property required for public purposes; or
                (b) a loan authorised by law;
        Operating Services means the ordinary annual services of the Government.

4. Issue, application and appropriation of $47 225 000
        (1) In respect of the financial year ending on 30 June 2024, the Treasurer may –
                (a) issue the sum of $47 225 000 out of the Public Account; and
                (b) apply that sum for the services of the Government.
        (2) The sum specified in subsection (1)(a) is appropriated.

5. Purposes of appropriation
    The sum specified in section 4(1)(a) is to be applied for the purposes specified in Schedule 1 and detailed in the agency information in support of the estimates for the financial year ending on 30 June 2024.

6. Expiry of Act
    This Act expires on 30 June 2025.

SCHEDULE 1 - Purposes of Appropriation 2023-24

Section 5
